title: How to Make Treacle Ale

steps.headline: Put the treacle (or molasses) into a large tub.
steps.description: Pour the boiling water over the top.

steps.headline: Allow to steep and cool down.
Add the yeast when it has cooled down.
steps.description: Prior to adding it, cream the yeast with a little bit of the liquor.

steps.headline: Cover the container and allow to sit for three days.
Skim if necessary and strain into sterilized beer bottles.
Cap with crown caps or other suitable bottle caps.
steps.description: Ask at your local wine and beer making supplies store for advice.

steps.headline: Set aside to mature.
steps.description: This brew can be consumed after one week.

text: Put the treacle (or molasses) into a large tub. Pour the boiling water over the top. Allow to steep and cool down.  Add the yeast when it has cooled down. Prior to adding it, cream the yeast with a little bit of the liquor. Cover the container and allow to sit for three days.  Skim if necessary and strain into sterilized beer bottles.  Cap with crown caps or other suitable bottle caps. Ask at your local wine and beer making supplies store for advice. Set aside to mature. This brew can be consumed after one week.
